{
  "file": "Default.aspx.cs",
  "vulnerabilities": [
    {
      "title": "Insecure JWT Handling",
      "severity": "HIGH",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-287",

      "line_numbers": [10, 12, 14],
      "recommendation": "Implement proper validation of the JWT, including checking its signature, expiration, and claims. Consider using secure cookie attributes (e.g., HttpOnly, Secure) to protect the JWT."
    },
    {
      "title": "Potential Information Disclosure",
      "severity": "MEDIUM",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-200",
      "description": "Debugging information is logged to the output, which may expose sensitive information about the claims and the application structure.",
      "line_numbers": [20],
      "recommendation": "Remove or restrict logging of sensitive information in production environments. Use logging frameworks that allow for configurable log levels."
    },
    {
      "title": "Redirecting to Login without User Feedback",
      "severity": "LOW",
      "cwe_id": "CWE-601",
      "description": "The application redirects users to the login page without providing feedback on why they were redirected, which can lead to confusion.",
      "line_numbers": [12, 18, 26],
      "recommendation": "Provide user-friendly error messages or feedback when redirecting to the login page to inform users of the reason for the redirection."
    }
  ]
}
